intro: Colobanthus subulatus, commonly known as Antarctic pearlwort, is a flowering plant native to the Antarctic region. It is a small, mat-forming plant that thrives in extreme cold and nutrient-poor soils. The plant has small, needle-like leaves and produces tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments through a specialized growth form and efficient water use. Botanically, it belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is an example of a plant that has evolved to endure extreme climatic conditions.
